Fundamentals of Filmmaking: A Digital Workshop: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Special Programs What Is Special Programs? Study Abroad Summer High School Summer in New York City Programs for Visiting Students Open Arts Minors Blog Events Newsletters Videos Admin & Faculty Alumni Contact Us  home > Special Programs        Fundamentals of Filmmaking: A Digital Workshop  OART-UT.560 Stu 4 Credits Instructor(s): L. Fritz This practical workshop is designed to introduce students to the techniques and theory of developing and producing short film ideas that are shot on digital video and edited digitally on computer using Adobe Premiere Pro software. The course centers on learning elements of visual storytelling through a spectrum of aesthetic approaches. Working in crews of four, students learn directing, shooting, and editing skills as they each direct three short videos (three to five minutes in length).  Note: This course is specifically designed to fulfill the major requirements in production of students not majoring in film and therefore, students who need to fulfill this requirement are given registration priority. Students should add themselves to the waitlist for this class. Tisch Film/TV majors and freshmen may not enroll. Students will be asked to purchase an external hard drive. Students are required to purchase personal property insurance for this course. This course is also available for noncredit. Students interested in   taking this course as noncredit should register with course number   NCRD-UT 560.001. Check Albert for course schedule. Please visit the NYU Bursar's website for tuition and course fee details.
